transcript.text: Shalom Shalom this is daniel john lee
with tour restoration ministries and
this is the dining hall actually the
library but it's been transformed into a
dining hall here at Casa Loma in Toronto
and if you see how beautiful and elegant
the tables are that's that's how yah
wants us to celebrate sukkot so coat is
supposed to be the most beautiful feast
of the year because it's pointing toward
the wedding supper of the Lamb we are
going to be with Yahshua the bride is
finally going to be reunite with the
bridegroom so this is just a small taste
as we're touring this Casa Loma castle
of what the wedding feast of the Lamb
will look like and you see how elegant
it is but this is nothing compared to
what the wedding supper of the Lamb will
look like when the feast of Sukkot is at
last fulfilled so it's just so beautiful
and look at that there's seven
chandeliers or a menorah with the
servant one in the middle biggest ones
it's like a menorah of chandeliers on
the ceiling it's a beautiful beautiful
room
and then if you go out onto the terrace
the garden terrace you can actually see
downtown Toronto this was owned by a man
who was one of the wealthiest man men in
Toronto 100 years ago we're in the early
20th century rather so anyway it's very
very beautiful and again it's it's just
like it's a perfect picture of the
wedding supper of the Lamb and there if
you look you can see a fountain that he
installed right in the front of his
castle very much like a picture of the
Living Waters that will be in existence
that will gush out from Jerusalem during
the millennial kingdom and will
eventually gush forth from his Allah
from the front of the Lamb and the new
heavens and new earth all right this is
daniel john lee with tour restoration
ministries day 6 of Sukkot Shalom
